title: Josh Jones (rugby)
text:
Joshua Jones (born 12 May 1993) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a forward for the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a> and <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> at international level.
He played as a for <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens</a>, with whom he won the <a href="2014%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2014 Super League Grand Final</a>. He spent time on loan from <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">Saints</a> at the <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> in the <a href="2014%20RFL%20Championship">Kingstone Press Championship</a> and the <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York City Knights</a> in <a href="2015%20Championship%201">Championship 1</a>. Jones played for the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a>, featuring for the club in the <a href="2019%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2019 Super League Grand Final</a>, and has also played for <a href="Hull%20FC">Hull FC</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
Jones was contracted to play <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> for the <a href="Exeter%20Chiefs">Exeter Chiefs</a> in the <a href="English%20Rugby%20Premiership">English Rugby Premiership</a>, and spent time on loan from <a href="Exeter%20Chiefs">Exeter</a> playing for <a href="Taunton%20Rugby%20Football%20Club">Taunton</a> in 2015.
Background.
Jones was born in <a href="Leyland%2C%20Lancashire">Leyland</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Early career.
Jones signed for St Helens as a 16-year-old in 2009 from <a href="Blackbrook%20A.R.L.F.C.">Blackbrook Royals</a>, after previously playing for <a href="Chorley">Chorley Panthers</a> and <a href="Leyland%2C%20Lancashire">Leyland Warriors</a>. He has international honours from his youth rugby days; playing for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> under 16s against <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France</a> Schoolboys in 2009.
Playing career.
St Helens.
In June 2012, Joshua signed a 3-year contract with St Helens.
St Helens reached the <a href="2014%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2014 Super League Grand Final</a>, and Jones was selected to play at centre in their 14-6 victory over the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
Exeter Chiefs.
On 17 June 2015 it was announced that Jones would be switching to <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> to play for <a href="Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a> club <a href="Exeter%20Chiefs">Exeter Chiefs</a> for the 2015-16 season.
Salford Red Devils.
However Jones' spell in rugby union did not last long, citing personal reasons, where he switched back to <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> for the start of the 2016 Super League season, signing for <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a>.
He played in the <a href="2019%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2019 Super League Grand Final</a> defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
Hull FC.
He will play for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> from the 2020 season.
Huddersfield Giants.
On 24 December 2020 it was announced that Jones would join the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> for the 2021 season.
In round 15 of the <a href="2021%20Super%20League%20season">2021 Super League season</a>, he was sent off after the full-time siren for fighting in Huddersfield's 40-26 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a>.
International.
He was selected in squad for the <a href="2019%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour">2019 Great Britain Lions tour</a> of the Southern Hemisphere. He made his <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> test debut in the defeat by Tonga.
